text: Martin John Lang (September 27, 1905--January 13, 1968) was a pitcher in Major League Baseball. He played for the 1930 Pittsburgh Pirates. He batted right- handed and threw left-handed. He was 5'11 and weighed 160 lbs (pounds). He attended Concordia University. Lang was born on September 27, 1905, in Hooper, Nebraska, and died on January 13, 1968, in Lakewood, Colorado. ==External links== Category:1905 births Category:1968 deaths Category:Major League Baseball pitchers Category:Pittsburgh Pirates players Category:Concordia Golden Bears baseball players Category:Baseball players from New Mexico Category:People from Hooper, Nebraska
title: Marty Lang
